subject: Sleep
title: The Glymphatic System
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Glymphatic System.

hook.text: Every organ drains waste through the lymphatic system. But the brain has no lymphatic vessels. So how does it clean?

buildup.text: For decades, scientists assumed the brain simply recycled its own waste internally.

discovery.text: In 2012, Maiken Nedergaard discovered the glymphatic system, a hidden fluid network that washes the brain.

twist.text: This cleaning system operates almost exclusively during sleep. It's nearly silent while you're awake.

climax.text: Cerebrospinal fluid pumps through the brain tissue, flushing out metabolic waste accumulated during the day.

punchline.text: Sleep is the only time your brain gets a deep clean.

quiz.question: When is the glymphatic system most active?
